trans-unit.source: Represents the contents of the `wsc:CallbackContext` message header when using a channel that supports the context exchange protocol.
The context exchange protocol allows for duplex communication between durable services.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> class with the specified context.
Information contained in the message which is identifiable by the client and the service instance between which the communication is taking place.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref>.
The callback address is the endpoint address that the service uses to call back to the client.
The callback address.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> and a <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> that contains context information.
The context information may include client instance and conversation information.
The endpoint address the client listens on.
Information contained in the message which is identifiable by the client and the service instance between which the communication is taking place.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> class with the specified listen address and context information.
The endpoint address the client listens on.
Information contained in the message which is identifiable by the client and the service instance between which the communication is taking place.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> class with the specified listen address and context information.
The endpoint address the client listens on.
Information contained in the message which is identifiable by the client and the service instance between which the communication is taking place.
Adds or replaces the current <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> instance within the specified message.
The message to add or replace the callback context message property.
Adds or replaces the current <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> instance within the specified message properties collection.
The message properties collection to add the callback context message property to.
Gets the callback address.
The callback address is the endpoint address the server uses to call the client.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> that contains the callback address.
Gets the context associated with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref>.
The context.
Merges the client's listenAddress and its context into a single callback address that is sent to the service.
The listen URI
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> instance.
Creates a copy of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> instance.
A copy of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> instance.
Gets the listen address and context data from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> instance.
A reference to store the listen address.
Information contained in the message which is identifiable by the client and the service instance between which the communication is taking place.
Gets the property name for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> class.
The property name.
Attempts to get a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> instance from the specified message.
The message to get the callback context message property from.
A reference to store the callback context message property instance.
`true` if the callback context message property is retrieved successfully; otherwise, `false`.
Attempts to get a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.CallbackContextMessageProperty"></xref> instance from the specified message properties.
The message properties collection to get the callback context message property from.
A reference to store the callback context message property instance.
`true` if the callback context message property is retrieved successfully; otherwise, `false`.
